hello!

I just wanted to say thanks to BNA! This is the first forum with really usefull info and a relaxed atmosphere on sharing knowledge. In the two days ive been here i learned more then i did in the four days before (browsing several other forums). Ill happily abide to all the rules to keep this forum open. Great job BNA!

GrtZ 3dioot

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Thanks!
Me cheers back to you.

I hope this forum can contribute to the knowledgebase of DOOMedit.
Good places are rare and I'll make sure this one stays as good as it could be.

Welcome btw

post.author: frittierteFolienkartoffel

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
hallo!



Quote:
What a triumph it was then both for him and for me, when one evening before a large circle of spectators—perhaps there was a celebration of some kind, a gramophone was playing, an officer was circulating among the crew—when on this evening, just as no one was looking, I took hold of a schnapps bottle that had been carelessly left standing before my cage, uncorked it in the best style, while the company began to watch me with mounting attention, set it to my lips without hesitation, with no grimace, like a professional drinker, with rolling eyes and full throat, actually and truly drank it empty; then threw the bottle away, not this time in despair but as an artistic performer; forgot, indeed, to rub my belly; but instead of that, because I could not help it, because my senses were reeling, called a brief and unmistakable "Hallo!" breaking into human speech, and with this outburst broke into the human community, and felt its echo: "Listen, he's talking!" like a caress over the whole of my sweat-drenched body.


"A Report to an Academy" by f.k.

post.author: Demon Cat
post.body:
Hello!

After a long hiatus from id games playing Tribes2, I'm back for Doom3/Quake4. I played too much QWTF, and then went on to major in ActionQuake 2 in college, making a couple DM skins for it along the way. Maybe they're still on Polycount somewhere.

In my spare time from gaming I like to convert gasoline into noise, study history, and do professional web devepment.

The current project is a teamplay mod for Q4.

post.author: -sam-
post.body:
Hello !!

My name´s sam, I´m from Munich, Germany.
I´m in the 3d Business now for about 6 years.
I´m specialized in 3dsmax/Vray/Rendering/Shading (non realtime).
check my unsorted web directory
http://sorceress.netfrag.org/optix/
I got into Q4 Modelling/Mapping about a week ago.
I did a lot of mapping for Q3 (years ago ). Now it somehow feels like a
flashback .
Glad I found this forum !! Hopefully I will get a lot of answers here !!

cheers

sam

post.author: Annihil4t0r
post.body: Hey. I'm new, and trying to learn modding, mainly programming since that's what I'm going to collage for in a year. I know C++, Basic, and Assembler. I've made a bunch of puny mods before, but I'm almost done with a gameplay mod that's good enough to go public. It's gonna be put up on moddb as soon as I get a website. I found this site on a google search to find stuff to augment my mod.

post.author: Phobos
post.body: Greetings guys, I run around on a few doom 3 forums. I'm applying for a job over at the Recall to Hell mod team. Figured this is one of the larger doom community forums so why not register? About time

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.author: phooks
post.body:
Aloha! I used to post in these very forums long ago, under the nick phooka... but I cannot login with that phooka nick...

Also, reading back to some of the posts I made two years ago, I wish I had never posted them!

For two years, the typical syndrome "Life/Job" kept on interferring with my main passion (anything game editing related), but heck I need to do some modding or I'll die!

So hi everyone, nice to be back!

David

post.author: booman
post.body:
Hey everyone. I've been studying the Doom 3 tutorials for the last two weeks or so and finally decided to join the forum. Great selection of tutorials. I'm sure I'll be asking plenty of questions as I work on my maps. I allready have some questions but I'm going to keep researching until I know for sure that no one else has answered it.
See ya around

post.author: Tesp
post.body:
Just a bit about me:

I am no modder at all. I am just a huge ID-Fan and a collector of their games. Since I am Doom 3 is one of my favorite games and I love the upcoming mods (Wolfenstein-Mod, Shamblers Castle II, Hexen: Edge of Chaos). I just can´t wait to get the newest infos of the projects and for the newest infos I need to go to the source

post.author: booman
post.body:
hey Tesp!
glad to have ya here.
there are a lot more Doom 3 mods at Planet Phillip (I hope I can advertise them here). I just played shamblers castle and LOVED IT! I will be doing a review for it on Planet Phillip. I can't wait for Edge of Chaos either. Keep checking out the site for new levels...

post.author: Tesp
post.body:
Thanks! Will do!!
Can´t wait for Edge of Chaos either

What a triumph it was then both for him and for me, when one evening before a large circle of spectators—perhaps there was a celebration of some kind, a gramophone was playing, an officer was circulating among the crew—when on this evening, just as no one was looking, I took hold of a schnapps bottle that had been carelessly left standing before my cage, uncorked it in the best style, while the company began to watch me with mounting attention, set it to my lips without hesitation, with no grimace, like a professional drinker, with rolling eyes and full throat, actually and truly drank it empty; then threw the bottle away, not this time in despair but as an artistic performer; forgot, indeed, to rub my belly; but instead of that, because I could not help it, because my senses were reeling, called a brief and unmistakable "Hallo!" breaking into human speech, and with this outburst broke into the human community, and felt its echo: "Listen, he's talking!" like a caress over the whole of my sweat-drenched body.

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
hallo!



Quote:
What a triumph it was then both for him and for me, when one evening before a large circle of spectators—perhaps there was a celebration of some kind, a gramophone was playing, an officer was circulating among the crew—when on this evening, just as no one was looking, I took hold of a schnapps bottle that had been carelessly left standing before my cage, uncorked it in the best style, while the company began to watch me with mounting attention, set it to my lips without hesitation, with no grimace, like a professional drinker, with rolling eyes and full throat, actually and truly drank it empty; then threw the bottle away, not this time in despair but as an artistic performer; forgot, indeed, to rub my belly; but instead of that, because I could not help it, because my senses were reeling, called a brief and unmistakable "Hallo!" breaking into human speech, and with this outburst broke into the human community, and felt its echo: "Listen, he's talking!" like a caress over the whole of my sweat-drenched body.


"A Report to an Academy" by f.k.

post.author: nd.LaZ
post.body:
Oh dear, I haven't posted in this topic yet. Shame on me.

Well LaZ is what most people that don't know me in real life call me. Allthough some people actually do call me that irl and that is quite annoying. It's a silly nick once you start trying to pronounce it.
I could tell you my real name but you might all be psychotic serialkillers so I'd better not.

I guess you'd like to know what a fellow like me is doing on these forums.
I basicly started lurking here when I suspected that a new computer was going to come into my life. My wet dreams of finally being able to play Doom3 got me so excited I had to go find some random info about the game on the internet to satisfy my lusts. That's when I stumbled upon Doom3World.
After a couple of weeks of reading about all the cool stuff happening in the MOD community I couldn't stand it anymore. I had to... Register.
So I did.

So here I am. Recently started on my very first map for Quake 3 to learn the basics. That's right. All the screenshots, topics and that damned Doom3 Can Do It Too project convinced me to pick up mapping. Damn you all for the inspiration!
Can't wait to do some boxy unbalanced maps with terrible texture alignment once I get that darned computer.

post.author: radix2
post.body:
nd.LaZ wrote:
... All the screenshots, topics and that damned Doom3 Can Do It Too project convinced me to pick up mapping. Damn you all for the inspiration!
Can't wait to do some boxy unbalanced maps with terrible texture alignment ....


Same boat as me. If you want any tips on how to create a boxy map with terrible texture alignment + really bad lighting, then talk to me

heh - I'm just poking around really. I am trying to learn, but I'm afraid that things are a bit beyond me at the moment. Still, it is fun learning and drooling over what talented people can do when they put their minds to it...

post.author: johnokaner
post.body:
What's up. this isn't 1st post but I thought id indroduce myself. (Was lurking here a long time before I posted)

Before started here with doom3 I was modding wolfenstien 3d (yes - there are still many people who do this) and was quite good @ it! Made textures, maps and did some code. When I got my new computer I started looking round for a fun, easy to mpd 3D FPS game. Played a lot of Half Life 1 (why do people here hate Half- Life) but found the editor totally confusing. Stuffed around with XSI for HL2 before it came out but never bought the game. Got Doom 3 and found this site and I love it!!!! Still going through the tuts learning how to map but am getting better. BIG difference between 2d and 3d mapping - your probably thinking 'well der!'.

Anyway I hope to become a good mapper -and maybe some modelling/code.
Currently playing Doom3, UT2004, UT2003 and am quite busy with school.

post.author: radix2
post.body:
johnokaner wrote:
... Played a lot of Half Life 1 (why do people here hate Half- Life) ...


I don't think anyone here hates HL. In fact I think you would find that most found it a lot of fun. However what people here will argue against is that HL2 is the second coming and the attitiude that some HL2 players have in regards to Doom 3 tech.

post.author: johnokaner
post.body:
Figured it was something along those lines. HL2 looks good but so does D3 so I guess it just depends what you are trying to do and what you like. I'm not one of those people who gets totally hyped up about a game and starts making bullshit claims about it can do! I just look at a game, appreciate what it can do and thank the people who improve on what it can't.

My thoughts.

P.S. Sorry for the off topic post.

post.author: gleeful
post.body:
greetings everyone!

it is this site's fault that i started mapping for doom3 and not hl2 or unreal.

having no mapping-experience whatsoever i took a long hard look around the net in order to find the resources you need when you're starting from scratch.

and guess what: doom3world.org was by far the best thing out there -
nowhere else did i find anything approximating the quality and quantity of your tutorials, nor of the resident community.

so thank you BNA!, Brain, Goliath, Mnemic and everyone else for making this site such a great place for newbies to start out!

kind regards
gleeful

post.author: mouse
post.body:
Hey people,

I'm mouse. I've been playing id games since Wolf 3D. Just love how id makes games, something about them. Doom 3 MP is incredibly fun and I really hope more is done with it - it's great for us old school FFA'ers. It brings me back to the Quake 1 days.

We run two servers (and will run a 3rd when URL redirection is done by a mod or patch for the game).

Our Doom 3 MP group is UMK - Undeniably misanthropic killers.

It's not a clan persay, just a group of people who like to play Doom 3 MP, so feel free to join and hang out! The website should be in my signature.

The name is Overmind, or most just call me Over. Funny Story: I was playing a game and I was introduced to a character named Undertaker, it went something like this, "Over this is Under, Under Over." Anyways, college student attending the University of Advancing Technology in Tempe, AZ. Even though I have no previous modding experience to speak of, that did not stop one of my profs from saying, "Make a mod". So thats why I am here. Plan on being a game programmer by profession, and this will pretty much be the start of my game design career. With that, I bid you a due. Hope to see you all around.

*bows*

post.author: BackFromTheDead
post.body:
Helllo.

My name is BackFromTheDead, I am 15 years old (will be 16 in December), and I live in an absolutely awful country called Russia I've been a classic Doom fan since it came out (yeah, when I was 4 years old I played Doom! ), and I am rather experienced in Old Doom editing & modding (did many sp levels and an unfinished TC for EDGE called Imp's Tales ) When D3 came out I thought it is a perfect ground for modding, and started learning all aspects of it (which is double hard for me, because unlike most of you I don't have a background of Quake editing) For now I know the map editor quite well, also learning about the scripts and gui format.

I would like you all to know that I'm free for recruiting and I'll happily work in a mod team, here are my skills:

- I've been fiddling with 3dsmax for 3 years, know it very well.

- Can work as a 2d artist (textures, decals, gui assets, etc)

- I write electronic music, mostly ambient or digital imitation of prog/death metal and grindcore (sound quite real though )

So, please hire me for a mod, never acted in something like that before.

Excuse me for my weak English, can't do anything about it

post.author: RiotGear
post.body:
I'm a 20-year-old (10 days to drinking age) computer addict. I feed my addiction and my wallet at the same time by selling people stuff at CompUSA, where I am currently a shelf-tagging grunt that can't even remember the TAP pitch. At least it's better than pushing around shopping carts and gas grills at K-mart.

Outside of that, I'm mainly a programmer. I've coded an insane amount of game-dev stuff, including an RPG engine, VM/JIT compiler, video encoder, and various compression toys. Not knowing what the hell I'm doing never stops me from coding it.

I also don't own Doom 3 because I'm currently broke and waiting for my next paycheck.

post.author: kat
post.body:
Slogbog wrote:
this topic was started in 2002? how were u guys editing doom3 in 2002??....
Nah, this board had been around for a couple of years prior to D3s 'official' release under a differnt name, Daily Desaster. It just so happened the BNA (the owner) and a couple of the then handful of regulars had an interest in Doom3.

When the alpha tech test got leaked this forum was basically the only one around at the time and it basicaly went ballistic with new accounts. It's been on the up and up ever since. There have been a couple of versions of this site as well so what you see now isn't the same as what it was a long time ago.

post.author: nd.LaZ
post.body:
Oh dear, I haven't posted in this topic yet. Shame on me.

Well LaZ is what most people that don't know me in real life call me. Allthough some people actually do call me that irl and that is quite annoying. It's a silly nick once you start trying to pronounce it.
I could tell you my real name but you might all be psychotic serialkillers so I'd better not.

I guess you'd like to know what a fellow like me is doing on these forums.
I basicly started lurking here when I suspected that a new computer was going to come into my life. My wet dreams of finally being able to play Doom3 got me so excited I had to go find some random info about the game on the internet to satisfy my lusts. That's when I stumbled upon Doom3World.
After a couple of weeks of reading about all the cool stuff happening in the MOD community I couldn't stand it anymore. I had to... Register.
So I did.

So here I am. Recently started on my very first map for Quake 3 to learn the basics. That's right. All the screenshots, topics and that damned Doom3 Can Do It Too project convinced me to pick up mapping. Damn you all for the inspiration!
Can't wait to do some boxy unbalanced maps with terrible texture alignment once I get that darned computer.

post.author: radix2
post.body:
nd.LaZ wrote:
... All the screenshots, topics and that damned Doom3 Can Do It Too project convinced me to pick up mapping. Damn you all for the inspiration!
Can't wait to do some boxy unbalanced maps with terrible texture alignment ....


Same boat as me. If you want any tips on how to create a boxy map with terrible texture alignment + really bad lighting, then talk to me

heh - I'm just poking around really. I am trying to learn, but I'm afraid that things are a bit beyond me at the moment. Still, it is fun learning and drooling over what talented people can do when they put their minds to it...

post.author: johnokaner
post.body:
What's up. this isn't 1st post but I thought id indroduce myself. (Was lurking here a long time before I posted)

Before started here with doom3 I was modding wolfenstien 3d (yes - there are still many people who do this) and was quite good @ it! Made textures, maps and did some code. When I got my new computer I started looking round for a fun, easy to mpd 3D FPS game. Played a lot of Half Life 1 (why do people here hate Half- Life) but found the editor totally confusing. Stuffed around with XSI for HL2 before it came out but never bought the game. Got Doom 3 and found this site and I love it!!!! Still going through the tuts learning how to map but am getting better. BIG difference between 2d and 3d mapping - your probably thinking 'well der!'.

Anyway I hope to become a good mapper -and maybe some modelling/code.
Currently playing Doom3, UT2004, UT2003 and am quite busy with school.

post.author: radix2
post.body:
johnokaner wrote:
... Played a lot of Half Life 1 (why do people here hate Half- Life) ...


I don't think anyone here hates HL. In fact I think you would find that most found it a lot of fun. However what people here will argue against is that HL2 is the second coming and the attitiude that some HL2 players have in regards to Doom 3 tech.

post.author: johnokaner
post.body:
Figured it was something along those lines. HL2 looks good but so does D3 so I guess it just depends what you are trying to do and what you like. I'm not one of those people who gets totally hyped up about a game and starts making bullshit claims about it can do! I just look at a game, appreciate what it can do and thank the people who improve on what it can't.

My thoughts.

P.S. Sorry for the off topic post.

post.author: gleeful
post.body:
greetings everyone!

it is this site's fault that i started mapping for doom3 and not hl2 or unreal.

having no mapping-experience whatsoever i took a long hard look around the net in order to find the resources you need when you're starting from scratch.

and guess what: doom3world.org was by far the best thing out there -
nowhere else did i find anything approximating the quality and quantity of your tutorials, nor of the resident community.

so thank you BNA!, Brain, Goliath, Mnemic and everyone else for making this site such a great place for newbies to start out!

kind regards
gleeful

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

hallo!



Quote:
What a triumph it was then both for him and for me, when one evening before a large circle of spectators—perhaps there was a celebration of some kind, a gramophone was playing, an officer was circulating among the crew—when on this evening, just as no one was looking, I took hold of a schnapps bottle that had been carelessly left standing before my cage, uncorked it in the best style, while the company began to watch me with mounting attention, set it to my lips without hesitation, with no grimace, like a professional drinker, with rolling eyes and full throat, actually and truly drank it empty; then threw the bottle away, not this time in despair but as an artistic performer; forgot, indeed, to rub my belly; but instead of that, because I could not help it, because my senses were reeling, called a brief and unmistakable "Hallo!" breaking into human speech, and with this outburst broke into the human community, and felt its echo: "Listen, he's talking!" like a caress over the whole of my sweat-drenched body.


"A Report to an Academy" by f.k.

post.author: headshotfairy
post.body:
Howdy folks,

I've been bumbling about the boards for a time, but it's time for a 'formal introduction'.

I'm currently working as a visual effects technical director for feature films. I have been working in the industry since the turn of the century and have been video game programming in various languages (yes, starting with basic) since I was 9. And yeah, I have 6 years of vintage Quake-C programming experience. (It's such a malleable and easy-to-code language!)

Anyways, I deal with a lot of particle effect animation for things that are too arduous to do by hand and AI simulations. This means lots of debris, weather effects, swarm AI and other stuff. I also solve problems with Maya, Mental Ray, Renderman and our proprietary rendering system. I develop software in C++, Java and MEL. Um, I have no formal programming education, I've just do so much that it's about as natural as breathing.

I'm looking to get out of my current career some day and start my own video games company, but for the time being, I have also been honing my drawing skills (I've been seriously drawing for about 3 years, and attending life drawing sessions for about two years, at least twice a week). I'm thinking the 'own-your-own-game-company' thingy will be about seven years from now. First, I have to go off to Paris and draw (and stay away from computers) until a year passes or I become friggin' amazing at drawing.

All that and I also like making music on my laptop PC with FL studio and Ableton Live, but that's because I'm the only person on earth who ignores email spam to have my organ enlarged and as a result I am shunned by the opposite sex.

Anyways, I'm here to provide a little insight and expertise with game modding (I've been at it for a loong time, and this stuff is lots more fun than working on movies) but I've limited time to spend since work gets crazy now and then. Please, don't make any private calls for help -- just post your stuff on the board and if I happen to graze upon it and a thought comes to mind, I'll try to lend a hand.

Happy modding folks!

post.author: matt_sefton
post.body:
Hi everyone -

Matt here - I'm heading up the Doom 3 Closed Caption and Transcription Modification Project for deaf and hearing impaired gamers that some of you might have heard about.

Many, many years ago (heh!) I ran quite a popular level review site on PlanetQuake - Single Player Quake Level Heaven - that morphed into SPQ2 Level Heaven, before my first child came along and put a stop to all that frivolity I also built many maps for Doom, Doom 2, Quake, Quake 2, Quake 3 and Heretic 2. Until Doom 3 came out, I hadn't touched a game for nearly 6 years, so I decided to jump headfirst back into things. I'm not building maps anymore - I decided to learn 3DS Max instead.

So that's about it from me. If there's any gamers out there who would like to help out on the Doom3[CC] project translating the transcriptions into foreign languages, give me a shot. We have Spanish, German, French, Italian and Brazilian Portuguese underway, but any other languages from territories where the game has been released are most welcome.

Cheers!

post.author: mouse
post.body:
Hey people,

I'm mouse. I've been playing id games since Wolf 3D. Just love how id makes games, something about them. Doom 3 MP is incredibly fun and I really hope more is done with it - it's great for us old school FFA'ers. It brings me back to the Quake 1 days.

We run two servers (and will run a 3rd when URL redirection is done by a mod or patch for the game).

Our Doom 3 MP group is UMK - Undeniably misanthropic killers.

It's not a clan persay, just a group of people who like to play Doom 3 MP, so feel free to join and hang out! The website should be in my signature.

post.author: BackFromTheDead
post.body:
Helllo.

My name is BackFromTheDead, I am 15 years old (will be 16 in December), and I live in an absolutely awful country called Russia I've been a classic Doom fan since it came out (yeah, when I was 4 years old I played Doom! ), and I am rather experienced in Old Doom editing & modding (did many sp levels and an unfinished TC for EDGE called Imp's Tales ) When D3 came out I thought it is a perfect ground for modding, and started learning all aspects of it (which is double hard for me, because unlike most of you I don't have a background of Quake editing) For now I know the map editor quite well, also learning about the scripts and gui format.

I would like you all to know that I'm free for recruiting and I'll happily work in a mod team, here are my skills:

- I've been fiddling with 3dsmax for 3 years, know it very well.

- Can work as a 2d artist (textures, decals, gui assets, etc)

- I write electronic music, mostly ambient or digital imitation of prog/death metal and grindcore (sound quite real though )

So, please hire me for a mod, never acted in something like that before.

Excuse me for my weak English, can't do anything about it

post.author: RiotGear
post.body:
I'm a 20-year-old (10 days to drinking age) computer addict. I feed my addiction and my wallet at the same time by selling people stuff at CompUSA, where I am currently a shelf-tagging grunt that can't even remember the TAP pitch. At least it's better than pushing around shopping carts and gas grills at K-mart.

Outside of that, I'm mainly a programmer. I've coded an insane amount of game-dev stuff, including an RPG engine, VM/JIT compiler, video encoder, and various compression toys. Not knowing what the hell I'm doing never stops me from coding it.

I also don't own Doom 3 because I'm currently broke and waiting for my next paycheck.

post.author: kat
post.body:
Slogbog wrote:
this topic was started in 2002? how were u guys editing doom3 in 2002??....
Nah, this board had been around for a couple of years prior to D3s 'official' release under a differnt name, Daily Desaster. It just so happened the BNA (the owner) and a couple of the then handful of regulars had an interest in Doom3.

When the alpha tech test got leaked this forum was basically the only one around at the time and it basicaly went ballistic with new accounts. It's been on the up and up ever since. There have been a couple of versions of this site as well so what you see now isn't the same as what it was a long time ago.

post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

post.author: Demon Cat
post.body:
Hello!

After a long hiatus from id games playing Tribes2, I'm back for Doom3/Quake4. I played too much QWTF, and then went on to major in ActionQuake 2 in college, making a couple DM skins for it along the way. Maybe they're still on Polycount somewhere.

In my spare time from gaming I like to convert gasoline into noise, study history, and do professional web devepment.

The current project is a teamplay mod for Q4.

post.body:
Hello !!

My name´s sam, I´m from Munich, Germany.
I´m in the 3d Business now for about 6 years.
I´m specialized in 3dsmax/Vray/Rendering/Shading (non realtime).
check my unsorted web directory
http://sorceress.netfrag.org/optix/
I got into Q4 Modelling/Mapping about a week ago.
I did a lot of mapping for Q3 (years ago ). Now it somehow feels like a
flashback .
Glad I found this forum !! Hopefully I will get a lot of answers here !!

cheers

sam

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
hallo!



Quote:
What a triumph it was then both for him and for me, when one evening before a large circle of spectators—perhaps there was a celebration of some kind, a gramophone was playing, an officer was circulating among the crew—when on this evening, just as no one was looking, I took hold of a schnapps bottle that had been carelessly left standing before my cage, uncorked it in the best style, while the company began to watch me with mounting attention, set it to my lips without hesitation, with no grimace, like a professional drinker, with rolling eyes and full throat, actually and truly drank it empty; then threw the bottle away, not this time in despair but as an artistic performer; forgot, indeed, to rub my belly; but instead of that, because I could not help it, because my senses were reeling, called a brief and unmistakable "Hallo!" breaking into human speech, and with this outburst broke into the human community, and felt its echo: "Listen, he's talking!" like a caress over the whole of my sweat-drenched body.


"A Report to an Academy" by f.k.

post.author: frittierteFolienkartoffel
post.body: Be friends now?

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

post.author: Demon Cat
post.body:
Hello!

After a long hiatus from id games playing Tribes2, I'm back for Doom3/Quake4. I played too much QWTF, and then went on to major in ActionQuake 2 in college, making a couple DM skins for it along the way. Maybe they're still on Polycount somewhere.

In my spare time from gaming I like to convert gasoline into noise, study history, and do professional web devepment.

The current project is a teamplay mod for Q4.

post.author: -sam-
post.body:
Hello !!

My name´s sam, I´m from Munich, Germany.
I´m in the 3d Business now for about 6 years.
I´m specialized in 3dsmax/Vray/Rendering/Shading (non realtime).
check my unsorted web directory
http://sorceress.netfrag.org/optix/
I got into Q4 Modelling/Mapping about a week ago.
I did a lot of mapping for Q3 (years ago ). Now it somehow feels like a
flashback .
Glad I found this forum !! Hopefully I will get a lot of answers here !!

cheers

sam

post.author: Phobos

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.author: Annihil4t0r
post.body: Hey. I'm new, and trying to learn modding, mainly programming since that's what I'm going to collage for in a year. I know C++, Basic, and Assembler. I've made a bunch of puny mods before, but I'm almost done with a gameplay mod that's good enough to go public. It's gonna be put up on moddb as soon as I get a website. I found this site on a google search to find stuff to augment my mod.

post.author: Phobos
post.body: Greetings guys, I run around on a few doom 3 forums. I'm applying for a job over at the Recall to Hell mod team. Figured this is one of the larger doom community forums so why not register? About time

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
If that's your signature, we surely wont become friends...
Please, for the sake of our 56k users, don't use 1.) images 2.) animations

(Didn't know the board could handle such long user names...)

post.author: frittierteFolienkartoffel
post.body: Be friends now?

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

post.author: Demon Cat
post.body:
Hello!

After a long hiatus from id games playing Tribes2, I'm back for Doom3/Quake4. I played too much QWTF, and then went on to major in ActionQuake 2 in college, making a couple DM skins for it along the way. Maybe they're still on Polycount somewhere.

In my spare time from gaming I like to convert gasoline into noise, study history, and do professional web devepment.

The current project is a teamplay mod for Q4.

post.author: -sam-
post.body:
Hello !!

My name´s sam, I´m from Munich, Germany.
I´m in the 3d Business now for about 6 years.
I´m specialized in 3dsmax/Vray/Rendering/Shading (non realtime).
check my unsorted web directory
http://sorceress.netfrag.org/optix/
I got into Q4 Modelling/Mapping about a week ago.
I did a lot of mapping for Q3 (years ago ). Now it somehow feels like a
flashback .
Glad I found this forum !! Hopefully I will get a lot of answers here !!

cheers

sam

I found this site on a google search to find stuff to augment my mod.

post.author: Phobos
post.body: Greetings guys, I run around on a few doom 3 forums. I'm applying for a job over at the Recall to Hell mod team. Figured this is one of the larger doom community forums so why not register? About time

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.body:
Hello!

After a long hiatus from id games playing Tribes2, I'm back for Doom3/Quake4. I played too much QWTF, and then went on to major in ActionQuake 2 in college, making a couple DM skins for it along the way. Maybe they're still on Polycount somewhere.

In my spare time from gaming I like to convert gasoline into noise, study history, and do professional web devepment.

The current project is a teamplay mod for Q4.

post.author: -sam-
post.body:
Hello !!

My name´s sam, I´m from Munich, Germany.
I´m in the 3d Business now for about 6 years.
I´m specialized in 3dsmax/Vray/Rendering/Shading (non realtime).
check my unsorted web directory
http://sorceress.netfrag.org/optix/
I got into Q4 Modelling/Mapping about a week ago.
I did a lot of mapping for Q3 (years ago ). Now it somehow feels like a
flashback .
Glad I found this forum !! Hopefully I will get a lot of answers here !!

cheers

sam

post.author: Demon Cat
post.body:
Hello!

After a long hiatus from id games playing Tribes2, I'm back for Doom3/Quake4. I played too much QWTF, and then went on to major in ActionQuake 2 in college, making a couple DM skins for it along the way. Maybe they're still on Polycount somewhere.

In my spare time from gaming I like to convert gasoline into noise, study history, and do professional web devepment.

The current project is a teamplay mod for Q4.

post.author: -sam-
post.body:
Hello !!

My name´s sam, I´m from Munich, Germany.
I´m in the 3d Business now for about 6 years.
I´m specialized in 3dsmax/Vray/Rendering/Shading (non realtime).
check my unsorted web directory
http://sorceress.netfrag.org/optix/
I got into Q4 Modelling/Mapping about a week ago.
I did a lot of mapping for Q3 (years ago ). Now it somehow feels like a
flashback .
Glad I found this forum !! Hopefully I will get a lot of answers here !!

cheers

sam

post.body: Hey. I'm new, and trying to learn modding, mainly programming since that's what I'm going to collage for in a year. I know C++, Basic, and Assembler. I've made a bunch of puny mods before, but I'm almost done with a gameplay mod that's good enough to go public. It's gonna be put up on moddb as soon as I get a website. post.author: Phobos
post.body: Greetings guys, I run around on a few doom 3 forums. I'm applying for a job over at the Recall to Hell mod team. Figured this is one of the larger doom community forums so why not register? About time

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

post.author: Phobos
post.body: Greetings guys, I run around on a few doom 3 forums. I'm applying for a job over at the Recall to Hell mod team. Figured this is one of the larger doom community forums so why not register? About time

post.author: Quickstep
post.body:
Hello

I'm delurking after about a 5 year lay off, basically since the registration was enforced here, I used to post a little before that as an annonymous poster, but never felt it really necesary to register, usually just rambled on incoherantly and signed off as Quickstep, I don't expect anyone will remember me, though anyone who can, are probably thinking oh no not him .

Well anyway, I'm a lazy bum really, not too bright, but otherwise harmless, see you around .

*Edit*

Well, in the unlikely event anyone re-reads this , I think my brain melted after keeping my reply to ViPr coherant, and entirely forgot to mention relevant bits you might be actually interested in ...

I'm a fantasy artist with a bent for realistic 2D digital paintings, and am perhaps notorious for working on peices for months, in some cases years, I started off in traditional, but moved to digital and loved it, cutting my teeth in photo-manipulation, then digital painting using the same texture manipulating skills I gained from manipulating photos.

I'm interested in moving to 3D and the excitement of the doom3 game engine really fueled that, but I've found learning to use 3D packages a bit daunting and difficult, I probably won't be posting much here, since I'm unable to produce anything worth looking at right now in 3D type stuff, but I'm patient if nothing else, I think my main concern is rebuilding my self confidence and learn again to take things a step at a time.

Quickstep.

Thanks for a fine forum, lots of neat stuff

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
hallo!



Quote:
What a triumph it was then both for him and for me, when one evening before a large circle of spectators—perhaps there was a celebration of some kind, a gramophone was playing, an officer was circulating among the crew—when on this evening, just as no one was looking, I took hold of a schnapps bottle that had been carelessly left standing before my cage, uncorked it in the best style, while the company began to watch me with mounting attention, set it to my lips without hesitation, with no grimace, like a professional drinker, with rolling eyes and full throat, actually and truly drank it empty; then threw the bottle away, not this time in despair but as an artistic performer; forgot, indeed, to rub my belly; but instead of that, because I could not help it, because my senses were reeling, called a brief and unmistakable "Hallo!" breaking into human speech, and with this outburst broke into the human community, and felt its echo: "Listen, he's talking!" like a caress over the whole of my sweat-drenched body.


"A Report to an Academy" by f.k.

post.author: frittierteFolienkartoffel
post.body: Be friends now?

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

Please, for the sake of our 56k users, don't use 1.) images 2.) animations

Thanks

(Didn't know the board could handle such long user names...)

post.author: frittierteFolienkartoffel
post.body: Be friends now?

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
frittierteFolienkartoffel wrote:
Be friends now?


Sure, thanks

It has become quite a fashion nowadays to link web page sized pictures or movie like gifs into the signature.
That makes it very hard to skip quickly through a thread for informations and dial up users (still the majority) will associate such a page with WorldWideWait while downloading "useless" decorations for sig's.

Take a look at your own forums:
Is more space for valuable informations reserved, does it get wasted for oversized signatures with 200 animated smileys?

No offense - just an observation.

BTW - the overall webdesign of your site is rather slick. No useless javascript code, no 1024 x 320 head banner and so on - thanks.

Good places are rare and I'll make sure this one stays as good as it could be.

Welcome btw
